bibl.author: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman
bibl.title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 24 March [1868]

revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Proofreading corrections, updated annotations on Galaxy and Sir Ball, date of Aunt Fanny's death date of letter, Martha Whitman's package,
corrected date format in title; added call no., annotations
Annotate Ballad of Sir Ball, Mary's Family, foolscap

body.p: its it's quite a spell since i have written at any rate it seemesseems so to me i should have wrote and said i had received the letter of fridayFriday but it was such a dreadful storm saturday Saturday then i thought i would wait till to day i have got the one you sent on friday Friday or i got it on friday Friday and one to day both with 5 dollars and the book for maryMary came friday Friday and the galaxy Galaxy to day with the ballad of sir ball i had forgotton forgotten all about the peice piece till i see it and then i had to think where i had heard of it and then it came to my mind what piece it was it is signed w i hope nobody will think you wrote it waltWalt)

Mary has gone home to day she has had a very satisfactory visit but she thought she must go to day she came last monday Monday a week ago yesterday) she thinks so much of her daughter minnieMinnie she almost worships her nothing but what they will indulge her in) when marthaMartha was there she seemed to think they were either
too close or stingy to or hadent hadn't the means but the means they have whether they have the heart or not to use the means they talk of selling their place and buying one up town further and one more stilish stylish after aunt fanny was buried they had a division of money that she had laid up it was equally divided between Ansel and Noah and georgeGeorge maryMarys Mary's son georgeGeorge maryMary said she dident didn't know how much they had but i shouldent shouldn't wonder if she did as her son georgeGeorge came down with her at any rate i gess guess they will keep what they have got) poor old woman she s she's been saving up i suppose all her life for who she knows not) i got a letter from mattyMatty yesterday i havent haven't had one in a long while they have got nicely fixed mattyMatty says and have laid out 1000 dollars that jeffyJeffy is glad they came and they get along nicely mattiMatty said she was going to send a box of things to me she said before she went away she would make me some things when she got settled and amongst the rest she said she would send eddyEddy a present too Edd said he thought matt was the best of all of them) mattyMatty says they was so glad to get your letter that i must tell you you must write often and she will write to you but Jeffy is so busy davisDavis is with them) i sent a small paper of lozenges to the children by davisDavis tied up with a thread matt said hattieHattie kised kissed the string and put it away cause grammagrandma had sent it

postscript.p: i had a letter or package from charley hay Charles Heyde three sheets of foolscap paper and a fool wrote on them
